importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The outbreak in the DRC was declared on this date, marking the official start of the current Ebola outbreak in the country.
No new cases have been identified since this date, indicating a potential pause in transmission and setting the stage for the 42-day countdown to end the outbreak.
The last Ebola patient was discharged on this date, marking a significant milestone in the containment of the outbreak and the potential end of the epidemic.
The 42-day countdown to declare the outbreak over officially begins on this date, with the world watching for final case confirmation.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: A 42-day period from the discharge of the last patient has been established to determine whether the outbreak is officially over, with the conclusion expected on or before November 10, 2025.

keyTakeAways: The last Ebola patient in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) has been discharged from a treatment centre in Bulape, Kasai province, marking a significant milestone in the fight against the virus.
This is the 19th recovery out of 64 total cases since the outbreak was declared on September 4, 2025, and the last case to recover has been confirmed.
The outbreak, the DRC’s 16th recorded instance of Ebola, began in the Bulape and Mweka areas and resulted in 53 confirmed and 11 probable cases with 45 deaths.
No new cases have been reported since September 25, 2025, which supports the possibility of the outbreak being declared over.
The DRC’s robust response, including the establishment of a 32-bed treatment centre and over 35,000 vaccinations in the Bulape area, was pivotal to containing the outbreak.
The World Health Organization (WHO) and partners have played a key role in supporting response efforts, particularly in the remote and difficult-to-access Kasai province.
The 42-day countdown to officially declare the outbreak over has now begun, with the world watching for confirmation of no new cases.
Ebola remains a deadly disease, with up to 90% fatality without treatment, and is one of the most feared infectious diseases due to its high mortality and rapid spread.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The World Health Organization has declared the final Ebola patient in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) discharged from a treatment centre in Bulape, Kasai province. This marks the 19th recovery out of 64 cases since the outbreak was declared on September 4, 2025. With no new cases reported since September 25, a 42-day countdown has begun to officially end the outbreak. The DRC’s robust response, including the establishment of a 32-bed treatment centre and over 35,000 vaccinations, has been critical to containment. The success reflects both local resilience and international support from WHO and partners, and brings the world closer to a significant public health milestone in a region historically vulnerable to such outbreaks.
title: Last Ebola patient discharged in DR Congo, WHO says
